translations.3903780517745703534: Your restaurant's app that simplifies order taking, and many other things.
translations.3283830909364254792: First line of code to manage orders for my ephemeral pastry
translations.6672029254061598329: Opening of my ephemeral pastry shop
translations.3165891852665740430: Creation of Oresto in order to make the tool accessible to everyone
translations.5501351628968102192: Create your menu in a few clicks, in a simple and intuitive way!
translations.8712597339952396119: Receive orders directly to your phone!
translations.575534507405451770: Manage your orders by marking them as delivered, then paid
translations.890808280864272828: Notify the customer that their order is ready using a {$START_BOLD_TEXT}beep system{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} integrated into the app
translations.7058218315111236278: Versatile graphics that allow you to filter according to the criteria that seem relevant to you
translations.359365445625077274: If any information is missing, let me know and I will complete this page asap üòâ
translations.2578958534330276348: Configure your restaurant to add all your colleagues, with the appropriate access!
translations.5801121513626516066: Add as many people as you want to your restaurant
translations.757016164214479175: Configure access to different sections of the app per user in order to maintain control over sensitive tabs
translations.8662136406851804917: It turns out that, two summers in a row, I opened a short-lived pastry shop in the village of my childhood, and on this occasion, I created this application to manage orders.
translations.8960524331881895146: I suspect that I am not the first, and probably not the last, to create this type of system.
translations.6322880886444830089: {$START_LINK}The ephemeral pastry shop{$CLOSE_LINK} was non-profit and allowed us to donate a few thousand euros to {$START_LINK_1}P√¢tisserie Solidaire{$CLOSE_LINK}, an association which distributes unsold sweet products to associations like
translations.6952222287747158660: You will have understood, the idea here is still not to become a millionaire but just to provide access to a tool to as many people as possible.
translations.8855477577505205051: The application already has several features:
translations.5110320332900371177: Notification to warn that the order is ready
translations.775050264596363913: The application can therefore be used in 2 different ways:
translations.4520078182482007656: Servers take orders via the app
translations.464925635370425464: Customers take orders directly via the app
translations.198481818468307587: These two options are obviously functional simultaneously.
translations.2873804599007945584: For customers to access the menu, they will just need to have access to your restaurant's link ({$START_LINK}https://oresto.app/en/{$INTERPOLATION}{$CLOSE_LINK}).
translations.3149569390383873575: We can even imagine generating a QRCode to simplify access to this url ü§© ({$START_LINK}https://oresto.app/en/{$INTERPOLATION}/admin?tab=qrcode{$CLOSE_LINK}).
translations.407711567121063134: If you have any questions or ideas for features, please feel free to contact me {$START_LINK}contact@oresto.app{$CLOSE_LINK} and I will be happy to respond!
